item.title: These Are the Top-Grossing PC and Console Games of Q1 2024, According to Report
item.description:
Highlights

  • Fortnite dominates the gaming industry in 2024, becoming the highest-grossing game in the first quarter.
  • New releases like Palworld and Helldivers 2 bring fresh excitement to the market alongside popular titles.
  • Newzoo's report reveals top-grossing games, with Fortnite, Helldivers 2, and Dragon's Dogma 2 leading the pack.

Fortnite is the highest-grossing game in the first quarter of 2024, according to a report published by Newzoo. The year 2024 for the games industry has been marked by events such as layoffs, Gearbox Software's acquisition by Take-Two Interactive, and the farewell to Nintendo 3DS and Wii U online services. Meanwhile, new releases like Palworld and Helldivers 2 hit the shelves, sharing space with popular releases like Fortnite and Valorant .

Palworld took the world by storm by showing a different spin on the monster-collecting game genre, quickly becoming a hit on Steam . Helldivers 2 became a new favorite among shooter fans, placing players on the Galaxy's last offensive line. Another title highly anticipated by gamers was Dragon's Dogma 2 , which, 12 years after the release of its predecessor, brings a new fantasy world to explore. With so many games to play, a new report revealed which ones pushed sales at the start of the year.

Related
Pokemon Scarlet and Violet vs Palworld Sales Compared
Palworld's viral success has been impressive for an indie title, but comparing its sales number to Pokemon Scarlet and Violet is even more noteworthy.

Newzoo has released a new report revealing the top-grossing games in the first quarter of 2024 on PC and consoles, and Fortnite has landed at the top of the list. In second place is EA Sports FC 24 , the first game since the end of the partnership between EA and FIFA. Helldivers 2 is a big success , and Arrowhead Game Studios' shooter confirmed its popularity by taking third place. In fourth and fifth place are Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 and NBA 2K24 , with the Newzoo report listing Madden NFL 25 (6th), Dragon's Dogma 2 (7th), Palworld (8th), Valorant (9th), and Rainbox Six Siege (10th).

Top-Grossing Games on PC and Consoles in the First Quarter of 2024

  1. Fortnite
  2. EA Sports FC 24
  3. Helldivers 2
  4. Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 (2023)
  5. NBA 2K24
  6. Madden NFL 24
  7. Dragon's Dogma 2
  8. Palworld
  9. Valorant
  10. Rainbow Six Siege

The report published by Newzoo covers game purchases and in-app spending in the US and Europe's five largest gaming markets - Germany, France, the UK, Italy, and Spain. Fortnite topped the sales in all countries, and despite EA FC Sports 24 's slow start , the game was the standout in Europe, accounting for 8.3% of total revenue. Newzoo also revealed the top-grossing games released in 2024 in the first quarter, with Helldivers 2 , Dragon's Dogma 2 , and Palworld taking the top three spots. WWE 2K24 and Persona 3 Reloaded appear in fourth and fifth, with Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League (6th), Tekken 8 (7th), Final Fantasy VII Rebirth (8th), Skull and Bones (9th), and MLB The Show 24 (10th) making the list.

Top-Grossing Games Released in 2024 in the First Quarter

  1. Helldivers 2
  2. Dragon's Dogma 2
  3. Palworld
  4. WWe 2K24
  5. Persona 3 Reloaded
  6. Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League
  7. Tekken 8
  8. Final Fantasy VII Rebirth
  9. Skull and Bones
  10. MLB The Show 24

According to Newzoo, the global games market has generated $184 billion in revenue in 2023, while this year's figures are expected to rise to $189.3 billion. Gamers are waiting to know whether these numbers will be reached since other anticipated 2024 game releases are still coming, including Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2 , Black Myth: Wukong , and Metaphor: ReFantazio .

item.title: Baldur’s Gate 3 Director Reveals Interesting Mechanic That Never Made It Into the Game
item.description:
Highlights

  • Larian Studios CEO Swen Vincke revealed scrapped plans for Baldur's Gate 3 to include a journey through the afterlife.
  • Modders have uncovered potential cut content, including clues about a canceled companion character.
  • Despite missing features, Larian has announced the release date for Deluxe Editions of Baldur's Gate 3.

Larian Studios CEO Swen Vincke has revealed that Baldur’s Gate 3 was originally going to feature entirely different death and resurrection mechanics. The cut features would have taken players on an immersive journey through the afterlife and expanded Baldur’s Gate 3 's rich lore and storytelling.

Despite selling over 10 million copies and winning many Game of the Year awards , Larian Studios recently broke the shocking news that it will be stepping away from the Baldur’s Gate franchise. Following the revelation that Larian will not be developing any DLC for the critically acclaimed fantasy RPG, players eager for more Baldur's Gate content have been keen to discover hidden features missing from the game's final release.

Related
Baldur's Gate 3: Neil Newbon Explains Why Astarion Was a 'Risk'
Neil Newbon discusses the performance choices he made portraying Baldur's Gate 3's Astarion, and why some decisions were risky.

Modders have begun to uncover clues towards canceled content, including evidence of a potentially cut companion character in Baldur's Gate 3 , while players have highlighted the many changes made over the game’s three years in early access. However, on PC Gamer’s RPG Roundtable podcast , Larian’s CEO shared an intriguing mechanic that never made it into the game. Larian originally planned to send dead characters on an adventure to an entirely new realm. “Whenever you died, you were supposed to go to the Fugue Plane,” said Vincke, “but the rest of your party would still be walking around in the material plane.” In Dungeons & Dragons lore, the Fugue Plane is an interim domain connecting the mortal Forgotten Realms with the many various afterlives, where deceased souls gather to be judged and assigned to their respective heavens or hells.

What is the Fugue Plane in Dungeons & Dragons?

  • The Fugue Plane is an interim domain connecting the mortal world with the many afterlives.
  • Deceased souls gather there to be judged and assigned to their respective afterlife.
  • Larian originally envisaged that dead characters would be sent to the Fugue Plane, but the idea was scrapped early in development.

Sending players on a journey through the Fugue Plane would have been the perfect opportunity to explore the nuances of Baldur’s Gate 3 ’s rich mythology. Spiritual clerics and paladins could have potentially appealed to their chosen deities for reincarnation, while evil-minded characters could be forced to face the consequences of their misdeeds. As the remaining party members would remain in the overworld, players could also potentially embark on high-stakes rescue missions to save their companions, similar to Baldur’s Gate 3 ’s thrilling descent into Avernus .

“Whenever you died, you were supposed to go to the Fugue Plane [...] but the rest of your party would still be walking around in the material plane.”

Unless players are dauntless enough to face Baldur’s Gate 3 ’s permadeath Honor Mode, dying in the final release of the game is an easily remedied affair. Players must revert to a previous save after a full party wipe, but a single character’s untimely demise is quickly rectified by the plentiful Revivify scrolls and spells, or via a trip to the camp’s resident undead miracle worker and potential God of Death, Withers. An extended trip into the underworld would flesh out this otherwise simple mechanic. Although fans will never get to experience this immersive feature, Larian has just announced exactly when gamers can expect their long-awaited Deluxe Editions of Baldur's Gate 3 .

item.title: Rumor: Next Mainline Tomb Raider Game Might Be Open World
item.description:
Highlights

  • According to a new rumor, the next Tomb Raider game may be fully open world and set in India.
  • Crystal Dynamics has remained tight-lipped about the upcoming game, only revealing a new Lara Croft redesign and Unreal Engine 5 use.
  • The potential decision to make the game open world may be divisive among fans, depending on how well Crystal Dynamics handles the layout and traversal.

The next mainline installment in the Tomb Raider franchise might be completely open world, according to recent claims made by an insider regarding the upcoming game. If this does end up being true, such a shift in design would mark a major departure from the gameplay formula established by previous entries in the Tomb Raider series, which have been largely linear and level-based up to this point.

Crystal Dynamics, the developers behind the first two entries in the critically acclaimed Tomb Raider reboot trilogy, announced at the State of Unreal showcase back in April 2022 that another installment in the long-running franchise had officially begun development. Outside of revealing the fact that the new Tomb Raider game would be made using Unreal Engine 5, however, the company behind the upcoming release has yet to share much information on the contents of the title itself. In the two years since the game's official unveiling, the only thing of note that Crystal Dynamics has formally revealed so far is the new redesign that Lara Croft will sport in the upcoming game. Other than that, it's been nothing but silence on the mainline Tomb Raider game front for quite a while now. However, some recently shared rumors may give gamers a glimpse of what to potentially expect from the upcoming installment in the iconic franchise.

Related
Tomb Raider Remastered Update Will Restore Removed Content
Tomb Raider 1-3 Remastered developer Aspyr reveal that an upcoming update will restore some content that was controversially cut from the game.

According to information shared by an insider named V Scooper on Twitter, the next Tomb Raider game will reportedly be "fully open world and set in India." Elaborating on this statement, the insider claimed that the title will feature "vast sceneries" and new transportation methods to help players easily traverse and overcome obstacles across a wide, unrestricted landscape. The new forms of transportation in question are said to include things like motorcycles and parachutes, in addition to existing traversal methods that prior versions of Lara Croft made use of in previous games.

After being asked when exactly the new Tomb Raider game would release, V Scooper claimed that although they didn't really have a clue, they did hear that it "might be soon" since the next installment in the beloved 90s video game franchise is allegedly "supposed to release in less than a year if there are no delays." Scooper did note, however, that this release window is not totally locked, so the title might still come out later than expected.

The Possible Decision to Make Tomb Raider Open World Might Prove Divisive Among Fans

Assuming this is all accurate information, the decision to abandon the linear level design of past games in favor of a completely open world might end up being a bit divisive among Tomb Raider fans. In the end, though, it ultimately depends on how exactly Crystal Dynamics handles the layout of the world itself and the way traversal plays a role within it. Before getting too upset or excited over this news, it's important to note, however, that these rumors are coming from a source that doesn't have much of a track record when it comes to video game-related leaks, so it's best to take everything mentioned here with a grain of salt. Regardless of how some feel about this potential rumor, though, Crystal Dynamics' upcoming Tomb Raider game is still poised to be one of the most anticipated games of 2024 and beyond, especially if it releases as early as the reports suggest.

item.title: Wizards of the Coast Addresses AI Concerns
item.description:
Highlights

  • Wizards of the Coast bans generative AI in Magic: The Gathering marketing after backlash.
  • The FAQ outlines rules for artists, writers, and creatives involved with D&D and Magic.
  • Policy allows AI use for concept work, storyboarding, but not final products like cards.

Wizards of the Coast , publishers of Dungeons and Dragons and Magic: The Gathering , has released a new FAQ addressing the use of generative AI in both franchises. As a controversial technology, it is an area that fans have been inquiring about. Generative AI has already been at the heart of controversy for Wizards, like when the company replaced AI-generated artwork in Bigby Presents: Glory of Giants for future printings after it was discovered AI artwork had been used.

In January, Wizards of the Coast ran into more trouble when it was found that Magic: The Gathering marketing material was using AI art. This happened after Wizards expressly said that there would be no generative AI used on Magic: The Gathering cards, and it prompted the company to revise how it handles marketing materials going forward. Dungeons and Dragons has also had major issues with AI, such as the example mentioned earlier.

Related
Wizards of the Coast Admits to Using AI Art
Wizards of the Coast responds to yet another AI art controversy, admitting the controversial technology was unknowingly used in some of its marketing.

Wizards of the Coast published an FAQ on generative AI use within the company and its products to address these concerns. This FAQ is the official stance of Wizards regarding generative AI, and its rules regarding the field. It states: "We require artists, writers, and creatives contributing to the Magic TCG and the D&D TTRPG to refrain from using AI generative tools to create final Magic or D&D products." Wizards has also banned generative AI in Magic: The Gathering marketing material after the aforementioned incident in January.

What Is and Isn't Included in Wizards of the Coast's AI Policies

The FAQ also explains how Wizards investigates whether generative AI is used in a product. While being quite vague, it mentions how it is a mixture of having a human re-reviewing art, using tools, and discussing the situation with the artist or creator in question. As Wizards of the Coast saw, false accusations of generative AI use can quickly spread, like what happened with the accusations that some of the One Dungeons and Dragons books releasing later this year were using generative AI.

Wizards also explains that the company will not be commenting on each case, as one of the primary concerns is the privacy of individuals working with the company, even if Wizards decides to no longer work with the artist going forward. Wizards further elaborates that while Hasbro may use generative AI in other products, like Trivial Pursuit , that does not mean Wizards will.

The policy elucidated by the company does have a couple of glaring holes, though. The first is the use of the phrase "final," which means that if it is used for things like storyboarding, concepts, or other work that doesn't make it to print, Wizards is perfectly fine with using generative AI. If an artist working on a Fallout Magic: The Gathering art piece used generative AI to create a depiction of a Deathclaw as it might appear on a card for reference, that is okay per this policy. The other giant loophole is the specificity of the policy, applying only to the core games of both, and thus wouldn't cover things like video games or movies.

item.title: Pokemon Sleep Entei Research Event Dates and Details Revealed
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon Sleep's Entei Research Event starts on May 20, giving players a chance to collect Entei Mane samples and encounter the rare Gen 2 Legendary.
  • Fire-type Pokemon will have unique bonuses during the event, increasing ingredient drops and main skill triggers to help players succeed.
  • Entei Biscuits will turn into Great Biscuits after the event ends, but players must exchange their Entei Mane samples before June 6 at 3:59 am.

Pokemon Sleep has officially unveiled the upcoming Entei Research Event, with the occasion kicking off on May 20. This limited Pokemon Sleep event will give players a chance to encounter the rare Gen 2 Legendary and add them to their sleepy team of Pokemon.

Pokemon Sleep 's purpose is to help players improve their sleep quality and ensure that they get regular, healthy sleep. To encourage this, players meet a Snorlax who is drawing in Pokemon from the surrounding area who doze in its presence. Pokemon fans can feed the Snorlax to encounter rarer Pokemon, and those that they befriend can join the player's team to help feed Snorlax special recipes and repeat the process. There are quite a number of Pokemon already available in Pokemon Sleep , but special events add unique Pokemon or increase the rate of discovering those already in the title.

Related
Pokemon Sleep Themed Hotel Room Opens in Famous Hotel Chain
Pokemon Sleep gets its own themed hotel room at a famous hotel chain to celebrate the sleep-tracking app's first anniversary.

Pokemon Sleep 's Entei Research Event will run from May 20 at 4 am through June 3 at 3:59 am. Players will be tasked with collecting Entei Mane samples, which can be traded in for Entei Incense, Entei Biscuits, and some valuable items like Main Skill Seeds and Fire evolutionary Stones . Entei will only appear on Greengrass Isle during this event, and will continue appearing after the event ends, but as a rare encounter.

How to Make the Most of the Pokemon Sleep Entei Research Event

Players should plan on prepping their best Fire-type Pokemon for the event, as they will receive unique bonuses. During the entire event, Fire-types will bring players an extra ingredient, and their main skill will have a 1.5x chance of triggering. Snorlax will also enjoy fire-type Leppa Berries , so players should choose Pokemon who have a chance of finding that berry. During the first week of the event, Fire-type Pokemon will have their Main Skill boosted by 1 level, and during the second week that will rise to 3 levels. Fire-types will also increase the drop rate of Entei Mane samples, which can be collected during a player's first sleep recording of the night.

Players who don't have a good team of Fire-types will also have an opportunity to change that. Charmander, Charmeleon, Charizard, Vulpix, Ninetales, Growlithe, Flareon, Cyndaquil, Quilava, and Typhlosion will have an increased chance of appearing after sleeping for the night.

Once the Entei Research event ends, Entei Biscuits will be converted to Great Biscuits and Entei Incense will be retained and can be used whenever a player likes, but Entei Mane samples will be lost if not exchanged in time. Players will be able to turn in Entei Mane samples until June 6 at 3:59 am.
